name: Unicode Text File
summary: Learn about .UTXT files and view a list of programs that open them.

content: UTXT files are similar to .TXT files, which are much more common. While many programs support UTXT files, they typically save plain text files with the .txt file extension.
Additionally, UTXT files typically use the following encoding standards:
UTF-8 – The most common and widely used encoding, as it is efficient for English and Western European languages while still supporting all Unicode characters.
UTF-16 – Sometimes used when files contain a large number of non-Latin characters, such as Chinese, Japanese, or Arabic text.
UTF-32 – Less common, but occasionally used when applications require fixed-width character encoding for easier processing.

instructions: You can open UTXT file with any text editor. Common options include Microsoft Notepad (bundled with Windows), Apple TextEdit (bundled with macOS), and gedit (Linux).

windows.name: Open over 400 file formats with File Viewer Plus.Free Download
